page.title: 03Staplehurst Parish Church
page.content: While Staplehurst does not appear in the Domesday Book the church at "Wealdenway" in the Monachorum of 1087 could refer to Staplehurst. Although the original church has been dated at 1200 the Saxon door is dated 1040 and could have been made for the church. The{Nave}and{Aisle}are 14th century and the{Chapel}was built in the 15th century and was once known as the Spilsil Chancel. The{Anchorite Cell}communicated with the the church though the round opening in the wall. The original{Font}stands by the pulpit and the new one next to the Knight's Heart. The{West Tower}was built between 1400 and 1425 and contains the{Clock}made in the 18th century by Messrs. Thwaites & Reed of Croydon.
